body_html:
The versioning on that package is funny. pip won't find it if you don't put the version number after the package name. That is why I was asking.
…
On Jul 3, 2017 2:08 PM, "Michaël Defferrard" ***@***.***> wrote: There's only one version of backports.weakref so yes. I think it's less restrictive for the users in case they release an update. — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. body:
The versioning on that package is funny.  pip won't find it if you don't
put the version number after the package name. That is why I was asking.

On Jul 3, 2017 2:08 PM, "Michaël Defferrard" <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> There's only one version of backports.weakref so yes. I think it's less
> restrictive for the users in case they release an update.
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
